majorBranches.name: Foundations
majorBranches.description: Fundamental concepts, logic, and set theory that underpin all of mathematics.

subBranches.name: Logic
subBranches.description: Study of reasoning and valid inference.

subBranches.name: Set Theory
subBranches.description: Study of collections of objects.

subBranches.name: Proof Theory
subBranches.description: Study of mathematical proofs as formal objects.

subBranches.name: Category Theory
subBranches.description: Abstract study of mathematical structures and the relationships between them.

majorBranches.name: Algebra
majorBranches.description: Study of mathematical symbols and the rules for manipulating these symbols.

subBranches.name: Abstract Algebra
subBranches.description: Study of algebraic structures such as groups, rings, fields, and modules.

subBranches.name: Linear Algebra
subBranches.description: Study of vector spaces, linear transformations, and systems of linear equations.

subBranches.name: Number Theory
subBranches.description: Study of the properties and relationships of integers.

subBranches.name: Commutative Algebra
subBranches.description: Study of commutative rings and their ideals and modules.

majorBranches.name: Analysis
majorBranches.description: Branch of mathematics dealing with continuity, limits, derivatives, integrals, and related concepts.

subBranches.name: Real Analysis
subBranches.description: Rigorous study of real numbers, sequences, series, and functions.

subBranches.name: Complex Analysis
subBranches.description: Study of functions of complex variables.

subBranches.name: Functional Analysis
subBranches.description: Study of vector spaces endowed with a limit-related structure and the linear operators acting upon these spaces.

subBranches.name: Harmonic Analysis
subBranches.description: Study of the representation of functions or signals as the superposition of basic waves.

majorBranches.name: Geometry
majorBranches.description: Study of shapes, sizes, relative positions of figures, and the properties of space.

subBranches.name: Euclidean Geometry
subBranches.description: Classical study of geometric properties in flat space.

subBranches.name: Differential Geometry
subBranches.description: Study of geometry using the tools of calculus and linear algebra.

subBranches.name: Algebraic Geometry
subBranches.description: Study of geometric shapes arising from solutions of polynomial equations.

majorBranches.name: Topology
majorBranches.description: Study of properties of spaces that are preserved under continuous deformations.

subBranches.name: General Topology
subBranches.description: Fundamental concepts of open and closed sets, compactness, and connectedness.

subBranches.name: Algebraic Topology
subBranches.description: Study of topological spaces using tools from abstract algebra.

majorBranches.name: Discrete Mathematics
majorBranches.description: Study of discrete structures, often used in computer science.

subBranches.name: Combinatorics
subBranches.description: Study of counting, arrangement, and combination.

subBranches.name: Graph Theory
subBranches.description: Study of graphs, which are mathematical structures used to model pairwise relations between objects.

subBranches.name: Foundations of Probability
subBranches.description: Axioms, events, and basic probability calculations.

subBranches.name: Stochastic Processes
subBranches.description: Study of collections of random variables evolving over time.

majorBranches.name: Statistics
majorBranches.description: Science of collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data.

subBranches.name: Inferential Statistics
subBranches.description: Drawing conclusions and making predictions from data.

subBranches.name: Bayesian Statistics
subBranches.description: Statistical inference based on Bayes' theorem.

subBranches.name: Machine Learning Foundations
subBranches.description: Statistical and algorithmic foundations of machine learning.

majorBranches.name: Optimization
majorBranches.description: Process of finding the best solution from all feasible solutions.

subBranches.name: Linear Optimization
subBranches.description: Optimization of a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints.

subBranches.name: Nonlinear Optimization
subBranches.description: Optimization of objective functions or constraints that are nonlinear.

majorBranches.name: Numerical Analysis
majorBranches.description: Study of algorithms that use numerical approximation for the problems of mathematical analysis.

subBranches.name: Numerical Linear Algebra
subBranches.description: Numerical methods for solving problems in linear algebra.

subBranches.name: Numerical Differential Equations
subBranches.description: Numerical methods for solving ordinary and partial differential equations.

majorBranches.name: Dynamical Systems
majorBranches.description: Study of systems whose state evolves over time.

subBranches.name: Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs)
subBranches.description: Study of equations involving an unknown function of one independent variable and its derivatives.

subBranches.name: Chaos Theory
subBranches.description: Study of complex, unpredictable behavior in dynamical systems.

majorBranches.name: Mathematical Physics
majorBranches.description: Application of mathematical methods to problems in physics.

subBranches.name: Classical Mechanics
subBranches.description: Mathematical formulation of Newtonian mechanics.

subBranches.name: Quantum Mechanics
subBranches.description: Mathematical foundations of quantum theory.

majorBranches.name: Information, Coding & Cryptography
majorBranches.description: Mathematical theories underpinning information processing, secure communication, and data compression.

subBranches.name: Information Theory
subBranches.description: Quantification, storage, and communication of information.

subBranches.name: Coding Theory
subBranches.description: Study of the properties of codes and their respective fitness for specific applications.

subBranches.name: Cryptography
subBranches.description: Techniques for secure communication in the presence of adversarial behavior.

rulesForExpansion: New specialties must clearly fall under an existing Level 2 sub-branch.
New sub-branches should logically group related specialties and fall under an existing Level 1 major branch.
Adding a new Level 1 major branch requires demonstrating its distinct foundational concepts and broad scope within mathematics.
